So I think that I’ll start taking those  single type commissions more often (like, opening only for d&d full body pieces or for badges only) to change things a bit! Next opening I’ll prob open for D&D token comms like the one I did for my wizard, just to warm up since those are quick and easy to do!

That said, none of the burnout and stress has anything to do with my clients (y’all are wonderful!!! 💖💖💖💖), and more to do with the fact that I’ve been doing things the same way for years and that + overworking stress has been weighing on me quite a lot lately 💦

I’m taking an extended vacation in between commission openings, cuz i’ve been feeling pretty burntout, lately year I took at best a week off, so the stress has definitely been building up, and I’ve been a bit frustrated with work and been thinking of changing a bit how I take commissions 😵‍💫
A proper token for my genasi wizard to use on roll20, cuz I've been using a placeholder since the game started lol #dnd #art #dndart
A proper token for my genasi wizard to use on roll20, cuz I've been using a placeholder since the game started lol #dnd #art #dndart
the dwarf one is SO PRECIOUS!!! And same here, I absolutely love it when clients send me little sketches and doodles of what they have in mind for their commission, it's so helpful!!!! 🥺💖💖

The Weeping God, Kinar. God of the Seas, the Moon, Lovers and Healing. 🌙🌊

#dnd #art #dndart

Lunestone is vry sought after by enchanters because its magical properties help cut down on the material cost of enchanting, and its also sought for high end expensive crafts as a status symbol! For Kinar worshippers, Lunestone is considered holy and a symbol of their god's fallen lover the moon 🌙

Some worldbuilding art! Kinar is one of the main deities of my homebrew dnd setting, and one of the things associated with him is a rock called Lunestone! Which are essentially pieces of the moon that fell to earth and are quite valuable, and this is a statue in world made p much entirely of it 💖

The Weeping God, Kinar. God of the Seas, the Moon, Lovers and Healing. 🌙🌊

#dnd #art #dndart

Back home from Barcelona, and ready to get back to work!! Here are some photos I took during the trip! <3
Spending Valentine’s Day in Barcelona with my love and much good food <333
Be smart about it and dont trust them blindly!

Its a dangerous thing to trust a complete stranger with how you curate your timeline, veto these lists before subscribing, they have been used maliciously before on twitter and now i’m seeing the same pattern happen here. It doesnt take too long to parse out the list and see if its trustworthy!

I think mute and block lists can be a very powerful and useful tool, but y’all gotta be careful when just subscribing to one of those without checkin who’s in it. Time and time again i see these “far-right mute list” and leftist accounts keep showing up on them because they annoyed the list maker

Enadak was cruel and sadistic, reveling on causing Virion pain and torment, as his property the aasimar knew no peace. He was a pretty trinket, a valuable accessory to the fiend that enjoyed flaunting his wealth in the City of Brass. The myriad of burnt scars in Virion's body are a constant reminder

since it's been recently revealed in a session, I can share this here! A quick sketch of Virion's former master/owner. Enadak is a collector of valuable rarities, and what's more valuable to a pit fiend than celestial blood it can possibly corrupt? #dnd #dndart #honsedoodles

Critical Role, anyone? Here's my boy Orym.

✨💙
Are you truly a professional artist until you go "I just gotta finish drawing this client piece and then I'll reward myself by drawing some more - for me!"

Like don't get me wrong, it's ok if role playing isn't your thing, but just checking out of the session when the other players are doing something that you don't want to do is REALLY frustrating to me lmao, this is a colaborative game!! at least pay attention to whats going on 😭

but in the call of the netherdeep game I'm in, everyone seems to actively seek out moments to roleplay and it's such a goddamn joy, i'm absolutely adoring seeing the characters bond and how their dynamics have been settling and we're only 4 sessions in!
... and it would just grind the game to a halt when we got to the other players because they'd have to be constantly reminded of what we were doing or where we were, it was really frustrating.

theres something really amazing about playing ttrpg with a group where everyone is as invested in actually roleplaying as you are, I've played in groups before where maybe me and one or more people were roleplayers (usually me and the DM lol) and the rest would check out durin RP moments...

artists! 

you can make your own media tab, here's how!

-log in to skyfeed.app
-click "feed builder"
-copy the settings below, make an art tag/keyword
-add an icon and a name/description, copy that link.

now you can add that link in your bio, and clicking it will show ONLY your tagged art!
